title: Three numbers in order - determine design

content.question: The variables x, y, and z are integers. Which of the following algorithms can be used to swap the values of the variables so that they are ordered from least to greatest (i.e., x ≤ y ≤ z)?

choices.label: Step 1:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.Step 2:If y is greater than z, swap the values of y and z.
Step 1:If x is greater than z, swap the values of x and z.Step 2:If y is greater than z, swap the values of y and z.
Step 1:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.Step 2:If y is greater than z, swap the values of y and z.Step 3:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.
Step 1:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.Step 2:If y is greater than z, swap the values of y and z.Step 3:If x is greater than z, swap the values of x and z.

content.answer: Step 1:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.Step 2:If y is greater than z, swap the values of y and z.Step 3:If x is greater than y, swap the values of x and y.

skill.text: 1.A: Determine an appropriate program design to solve a problem or accomplish a task.
